info.name: Embloy-API Collection
info.description:
Welcome to our Postman Collection! Here you can find and test all public Embloy-API endpoints using Postman. # Common Error Codes | Error | Description | Solution | | --- | --- | --- | | 400 Bad Request | Our server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax. | Ensure all required fields are correctly filled. | | 401 Unauthorized | The request requires user authentication. | Verify your access token is valid and included in the request headers (see [RFC 6750: Bearer Token](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6750)). | | 403 Forbidden | You do not have permission to access the requested resource. | Check your user permissions and API scopes. The action you performed might require a subscription. | | 404 Not Found | The requested resource could not be found. | Ensure the endpoint URL and resource ID are correct. | | 409 Conflict | The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target resource. | Resolve the conflict before retrying the request (e.g., you already applied to a job or are trying to reject an already rejected application). | | 429 Too Many Requests / Unprocessable Entity | You have exhausted the limit of a resource given your current subscription or trying to persist more entites than allowed. | Make sure that you have a valid subscription and don't have surpassed its usage limits (e.g., trying to create more jobs than your subscription allows or applying for the same job twice). | | 500 Internal Server Error | Our server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request. | Try again later or check [status.embloy.com](https://status.embloy.com).
If the issue persists, please contact our support. | | 503 Service Unavailable | The server is currently unable to handle the request due to maintenance or you probably have sent too many requests in a given amount of time ("rate limiting"). | Try again later or reduce the frequency of requests. | # Getting Started ## Step 1: Fork the collection using Run in Postman [](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/24977803-e44099dd-6647-4b78-bd7a-03293e47dee5?action=collection%2Ffork&source=rip_markdown&collection-url=entityId%3D24977803-e44099dd-6647-4b78-bd7a-03293e47dee5%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3D6b47d1cc-f4b3-4522-8ab1-98a55f18324c) ## Step 2 (method 1): Create a new access token automatically 1. Sign into our [recruiter portal](https://genius.embloy.com) or [create a new Embloy account](https://embloy.com/register) 2. Create a new access token by going to the "secrets" tab of your [Embloy Genius settings](https://genius.embloy.com/settings?tab=secrets) and pressing on the "create access token" button and save it to the `access_token` variable in Postman ## Step 2 (method 2): Get your access token manually #### If you don't have an account yet: 1. Create new user `POST:/user` 2. Verify user `GET:/user/verify` 3. Activate account using the link sent to your email 4. Request new refresh token via `POST:/user/auth/token/refresh` using your credentials 5. Save the JWT you received in the variable `refresh_token` 6. Request new access token with `POST:/user/auth/token/access` 7. Save access token to variable `access_token` #### Else, sign in with existing account: 1. Request new refresh token via `POST:/user/auth/token/refresh` using your credentials 2. Save the JWT you received in the variable `refresh_token` 3. Request new access token with `POST:/user/auth/token/access` 4. Save access token to variable `access_token` ## Step 3: Make your first API call Embloy recommends starting with the Jobs and Quicklink APIs. These steps will use the Jobs and Quicklink APIs to create a job and capture applications using [sandbox accounts](https://developers.embloy.com/docs/core/subscriptions/subscription_features) linked to your Developer Dashboard account. To create a job: 1. In your workspace, navigate to your fork of the Embloy collection. 2. Select **Jobs > Create job**. 3. Select the **Send** button to create the job. On a successful call, the API returns a `201 Created` response code. To upload an application: 1. In **User > Get user's jobs**, find the `id` of the job you created. 2. In the **Variables** tab, enter it into the `job_id` field. 3. Select **Applications > Submit application**. 4. Select **Send**. On a successful call, the API returns a `201 Created` code. Your job has been created and an application has been captured. You can review the submitted application in the [Embloy Genius dashboard](https://genius.embloy.com/recruitment). # Debugging You might encounter some of the following errors when using unauthorized access tokens: > **NOTE:** _Find out more about our access tokens and scopes in our_ [<em>developer docs</em>](https://developers.embloy.com/docs/core/tokens/token_info#access-token)_._ | Scope | Error | Description | Solution | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | user | 400: ERR_INVALID | Attribute cannot be retrieved. | Ensure the attribute name is correct and the attribute exists. | | token | 400: ERR_INVALID | Attribute is invalid or expired. | Verify the token's validity and ensure it has not expired. | | token | 403: ERR_RAC | The scope 'genius.embloy.com/api.write' is not allowed because it does not match the application's base URL. | Check that the scope matches the application's base URL. | | token | 403: ERR_RAC | The requested path '/integrations/auth/xyz' is not allowed for scope 'api.embloy.com/api.write'. | Ensure the requested path is correct and within the allowed scope. | | token | 403: ERR_RAC | The scope 'api.embloy.com/api.read' is not allowed to perform the 'PATCH' method. | Verify that the scope has the correct permissions for the desired HTTP method. |

item.name: Authentication

request.description: This makes sure that the Embloy account was registerd successfully and automatically claims the initial refresh token. Verifying an account is mandatory before using any function of Embloy's plattform.

response.name: 200 OK

request.description: Activate a user's account given an activation token. If the activation token has expired, it can be re-requested [here](https://embloy.com/activation-token) or using [this endpoint](https://www.postman.com/embloy/workspace/embloy-workspace/request/24977803-75b9eed7-22e0-4978-8693-04926bb0ebf0).

formdata.description: Your account email to which the activation link will be sent.

request.description:
Re-request an activation link for the case that the activation link sent upon account creation has expired.

Activation links have a validity of one day.

request.description:
Generates and sends a new One-Time Passcode (OTP) to your email if the email is linked to an account.

The OTP is valid for 30 minutes and can only be used once.

request.description: This first authenticates the account credentials and then issues a refresh token for this specific verified Embloy account. Refresh tokens only possess a time-limited validity. (current default validity is 2 weeks) Refresh tokens are primarily used to claim the much more powerful (but much shorter valid) access tokens.

response.name: 403 Forbidden
503 Service Unavailable
response.body: Rate limit exceeded. Please try again later.

urlencoded.description: A valid refresh token is needed in order to be able to create an access_token.

Specifies the type of access delegation according to the authorization grant. This parameter tells the authorization server what kind of authorization grant (i.e., method of proving identity) the client application is presenting in exchange for an access token.

request.description: This first verifies the provided refresh token and then issues an access token for the specific account associated with the refresh token. Access tokens only possess a very short time-limited validity or 20 minutes currently. Access tokens are a very important aspect of dealing with the Embloy API. Nearly every endpoint requires the provision of a valid access token. In conclusion access tokens are quite powerfull, have a short validity interval and can be claimend with a valid refresh token. Refresh tokens are less powerfull than access tokens but they possess a longer validity intervall and are mainly used for claiming access tokens.

urlencoded.description: A valid refresh token is needed in order to be able to create an access_token.

Specifies the type of access delegation according to the authorization grant. This parameter tells the authorization server what kind of authorization grant (i.e., method of proving identity) the client application is presenting in exchange for an access token.
A valid refresh token is needed in order to be able to create an access_token.

A valid refresh token is needed in order to be able to create an access_token.

request.description:
Creates and stores a new token for the current user.

- Valid token types are `refresh_token`, `access_token`, `request_token`, `client_token`, `api_key`.
    
- Valid token issuers are `embloy`, `ashby`, `lever`, `softgarden`
    

Please note that only users with a valid Embloy subscription are allowed to create new tokens.

item.description:
All request regarding token / API keys / third party secrets storage and creation.

> _**Note:**_ _The actual token encoding and decoding is done outside of this controller. These endpoints only handle already created tokens and store them for a given user._

request.description:
The provided access token is first verified, and then a new job is created. Upon creation, a job is listed as public. Public jobs undergo evaluation by Embloy's Job Ranking Engine and may appear in a user's individual job feed. Moreover, such jobs are open to applications from interested candidates. The job creator/owner or correspondingly authorized users correspondingly authorized users are able to limit the visibility of the job to "private". Private jobs are ignored by the Job Ranking Engine and so do not appear to any job seeking user.

The user can customize how the application process should look like by specifying `application_options_attributes`. Read more on that in the [developers documentation](https://developers.embloy.com/docs/core/jobs/create_jobs).

item.description:
All requests related to job finding & handling.

#### Note #1:

`POST:/user/image`, `POST:/jobs` and `POST:/jobs/{job_id}/applications` require you to insert a local file to be submitted.

#### Note #2:

`POST:/jobs` needs a valid `start_slot` date to be created. To do so, you need to make sure that the date lies in the future and is not more than one year in advance.

Returns all registered webhooks of a user known to Embloy. In case this is out of sync with the the third party service that provides the webhooks, see this endpoint.
Returns all application events linked to a user.

variable.description: Service that needs to refresh its webhooks. Allowed values are:`embloy`,`lever`,`ashby`

request.description: This endpoint is used to re-synchronize the webhook configurations between Embloy and a third party service. Resets all user's webhooks for a selected service. To do this, it first fetches the desired webhooks, compares them with the current webhooks registerd in the third party service, and then creates or updates them accordingly.

formdata.value:
The World's First Job Application API

Deliver outstanding candidate experiences by offering the option to apply with Embloy.

Find out more at https://about.embloy.com/en/.

Sign up to Embloy and apply for jobs with Venmo-like simplicity. Create an account once, use it to apply with one click and manage your applications in one place.

item.name: Quicklink

query.description: Custom expiration (will be set to the end of client's subscription, if it exceeds the subscription's expiration date)

request.description:
If the user has the necessary role, a **`client_token`** is generated based on  
the decoded subject (sub) of the token. The generated **`client_token`** is  
then returned in the response (valid for 3months).

header.description: A valid client_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the client. For further information see: [client_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#86b2cf1c-b02e-4d83-b65f-9c5e03cc89c4)

request.description:
This endpoint is responsible for creating a new application session containing a **`request_token`** which can be further used to apply for a specific job and client with a validity of 30 minutes. It uses the decoded **`client_token`**'s subject (sub) and a specific identifier ("df074300-2627-4511-985e-e62c69dc0d7g") to generate the token. The generated request token is then returned in the response which can be used as authentication for further requests to the core-API.

**If you're an ATS provider, make sure to set** **`mode`** **as the name of your ATS system (e.g., "Lever", "Ashby", "Greenhouse", etc.) and** **`job_slug`** **as the current job's posting ID.**

header.description: A valid client_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the client. For further information see: [client_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#86b2cf1c-b02e-4d83-b65f-9c5e03cc89c4)

request.description:
Handles the _Quicklink_ application process. It finds the user based on the decoded  
user's **`access_token`** token's subject (sub) and the client based on the  
decoded **`request_token`**'s subject (sub). The method then  
updates or creates the job based on the decoded **`request_token`**'s job  
information and applies for the job.

response.name: 200 OK

header.description: Request token generated by referrer's client'token which contains all relevant job information.

request.description:
Handles the _Quicklink_ application process. It finds the user based on the decoded  
user's **`access_token`** token's subject (sub) and the client based on the  
decoded **`request_token`**'s subject (sub). The method then  
updates or creates the job based on the decoded **`request_token`**'s job  
information and applies for the job.

Optional ID of a user profile
Optional expiration date for the link. The default value is 1 day, and can be customized to a value between 1 minute and 1 year.

request.description:
Genius-Queries act as a method to access a specific resource from external services and pages for a limited amount of time by using unique link that can be used to access a single resource.

To create such a query, only a `job_id`or `user_id` (and optionally a \`expires_as\` field) are necessary.

The default validity of a Genius-Query is one day.

query.description: Option ID of a job owned by the current user
Optional ID of a user profile
Optional expiration date for the link. The default value is 1 day, and can be customized to a value between 1 minute and 1 year.

request.description: This is a test endpoint used to handle job applications for open positions at Embloy which are submitted via [genius.embloy.com](https://genius.embloy.com).

item.description:
All requests currently supported by the Genius-API.

// TODO

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: This endpoint is responsible for creating a **`request_token`**. for a specific job and client with a validity of 30 minutes. It uses the decoded **`client_token`**'s subject (sub) and a specific identifier ("job#1") to generate the token. The generated request token is then returned in the response which can be used as authentication for further requests to the core-API.
